2309 |  **   Result:		string		The chopped string		     **
2310 |  **									     **
2311 |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
2312 |  ** 									     **
2313 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
2314 |  ++++*/
2315 | 
2316 | static	char *chop( const char	*string)
2317 | {
2318 |     char	*s, *t;			/** source and target pointers       **/
2319 | 
2320 | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
2321 |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_chop, NULL);
2322 | #endif
2323 | 
2324 |     /**
2325 |      **  Remove '\n'
2326 |      **/
2327 | 
2328 |     s = t = (char *) string;
2329 |     while( *s) {
2330 | 	if( '\n' == *s)
2331 | 	    s++;
2332 | 	else
2333 | 	    *t++ = *s++;
2334 |     }
2335 | 
2336 |     /**
2337 |      **  Copy the trailing terminator and return
2338 |      **/
2339 |     *t++ = '\0';
2340 |     return( (char *) string);
2341 | 
2342 | } /** End of 'chop' **/
2343 | 
2344 | 
2345 | /*++++
2346 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
2347 |  ** 									     **
2348 |  **   Function:		xstrtok_r,xstrtok				     **
2349 |  ** 									     **
2350 |  **   Description: 	Considers the string s to consist of a sequence of   **
2351 |  **			zero or more text tokens separated by spans of one   **
2352 |  **			or more characters from the separator string  delim. **
2353 |  **			Just like the "standard" strtok(3), and the
2354 |  **			reentrant version strtok_r(3).			     **
2355 |  **			Except this tokenizer will return "empty" tokens too.**
2356 |  **			Providing our own strtok() eliminates the various    **
2357 |  **			nuances of different implementations.		     **
2358 |  **									     **
2359 |  **   First Edition:	2006/04/17	R.K.Owen <rk@owen.sj.ca.us>	     **
2360 |  ** 									     **
2361 |  **   Parameters:							     **
2362 |  **   Result:								     **
2363 |  **   Attached Globals:							     **
2364 |  ** 									     **
2365 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
2366 |  ++++*/
2367 | 
2368 | char *xstrtok_r(char *s, const char *delim, char **ptrptr) {
2369 | 	register char	*ptr, *lptr;
2370 | 	const char	*tok;
2371 | 
2372 | 	/* return NULL if NULL string and at end of the line */
2373 | 	if (s == NULL && *ptrptr == NULL)
2374 | 		return (NULL);
2375 | 
2376 | 	/* do not skip leading (or trailing) delimiters ... */
2377 | 
2378 | 	/* if non-NULL string then at beginning of token parsing */
2379 | 	if (s != NULL)	*ptrptr = s;
2380 | 
2381 | 	ptr = *ptrptr;
2382 | 	while (ptr && *ptr) {
2383 | 		/* cycle through delimiters */
2384 | 		tok = delim;
2385 | 		while (tok && *tok) {
2386 | 			if (*ptr == *tok) {	/* match */
2387 | 				*ptr = '\0';	/* null terminate */
2388 | 				lptr = *ptrptr;
2389 | 				*ptrptr = ++ptr;	/* set for next time */
2390 | 				return  lptr;
2391 | 			}
2392 | 			tok++;
2393 | 		}
2394 | 		ptr++;
2395 | 	}
2396 | 	/* didn't find delimiter */
2397 | 	lptr = *ptrptr;
2398 | 	*ptrptr = NULL;
2399 | 	return lptr;
2400 | } /** End of 'xstrtok_r' **/
2401 | 
2402 | char *xstrtok(char *s, const char *delim) {
2403 | 	static char	*last;
2404 | 	return	xstrtok_r(s,delim,&last);
2405 | } /** End of 'xstrtok' **/
2406 | 
2407 | #if 0
2408 | void tryxstrtok (char *string, char *delim) {
2409 | 	char *start, *str;
2410 | 	char *token;
2411 | 	int n = 1;
2412 | 
2413 | 	start = str = strdup(string);
2414 | 	printf("string: %s\n", str);
2415 | 	printf("delim : %s\n", delim);
2416 | 	
2417 | 	token = xstrtok(str,delim);
2418 | 	printf("\t%d = %s\n", n, token);
2419 | 	while (token = xstrtok(NULL, delim)) {
2420 | 		printf("\t%d = %s\n", ++n, token);
2421 | 	}
2422 | 	free(start);
2423 | }
2424 | int main () {
2425 | 	tryxstrtok("abc:def;ghi,jkl", ":;,");
2426 | 	tryxstrtok(":abc:def;ghi,jkl", ":;,");
2427 | 	tryxstrtok("::abc:def;ghi,jkl", ":;,");
2428 | 	tryxstrtok("abc:def;ghi,jkl:", ":;,");
2429 | 	tryxstrtok("abc:def;ghi,jkl::", ":;,");

2486 | /*++++
2487 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
2488 |  ** 									     **
2489 |  **   Function:		xdup						     **
2490 |  ** 									     **
2491 |  **   Description:	will return a string with 1 level of environment     **
2492 |  ** 			variables expanded. The limit is MOD_BUFSIZE.	     **
2493 |  ** 			An env.var. is denoted with either $name or ${name}  **
2494 |  **			\$ escapes the expansion and substitutes a '$' in    **
2495 |  **			its place.					     **
2496 |  ** 									     **
2497 |  **   First Edition:	2000/01/21	R.K.Owen <rk@owen.sj.ca.us>	     **
2498 |  ** 									     **
2499 |  **   Parameters:	char	*string		Environment variable	     **
2500 |  ** 									     **
2501 |  **   Result:		char    *		An allocated string	     **
2502 |  ** 									     **
2503 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
2504 |  ++++*/
2505 | 
2506 | 
2507 | char *xdup(char const *string) {
2508 | 	char *result = NULL;
2509 | 	char *dollarptr;
2510 | 
2511 | 	if (string == (char *)NULL) return result;
2512 | 
2513 | 	/** need to work from copy of string **/
2514 | 	if (((char *) NULL) == (result = stringer(NULL,0, string, NULL)))
2515 | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
2516 | 		return( (char*) NULL);	/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
2517 | 
2518 | 	/** check for '$' else just pass copy of it **/
2519 | 	if ((dollarptr = strchr(result, '$')) == (char *) NULL) {
2520 | 		return result;
2521 | 	} else {
2522 | 	/** found something **/
2523 | 		char const *envvar;
2524 | 		char  buffer[MOD_BUFSIZE];
2525 | 		char  oldbuffer[MOD_BUFSIZE];
2526 | 		size_t blen = 0;	/** running buffer length	**/
2527 | 		char *slashptr = result;/** where to continue parsing	**/
2528 | 		char  slashchr;		/** store slash char		**/
2529 | 		int   brace;		/** flag if ${name}		**/
2530 | 		pid_t pid;		/** the process id		**/
2531 | 
2532 | 		/** zero out buffers */
2533 | 		memset(   buffer, '\0', MOD_BUFSIZE);
2534 | 		memset(oldbuffer, '\0', MOD_BUFSIZE);
2535 | 
2536 | 		/** copy everything upto $ into old buffer **/
2537 | 		*dollarptr = '\0';
2538 | 		strncpy(oldbuffer, slashptr, MOD_BUFSIZE);
2539 | 		*dollarptr = '$';
2540 | 
2541 | 		while (dollarptr) {
2542 | 			if (*oldbuffer) strncpy(buffer, oldbuffer, MOD_BUFSIZE);
2543 | 			blen = strlen(buffer);
2544 | 
2545 | 			/** get the env.var. name **/
2546 | 			if (*(dollarptr + 1) == '{') {
2547 | 				brace = 1;
2548 | 				slashptr = strchr(dollarptr + 1, '}');
2549 | 			} else if (*(dollarptr + 1) == '$') {
2550 | 				slashptr = dollarptr + 2;
2551 | 			} else {
2552 | 				slashptr = dollarptr + 1
2553 | 					+ strcspn(dollarptr + 1,"/:$\\");
2554 | 				brace = 0;
2555 | 			}
2556 | 			if (*slashptr) {
2557 | 				slashchr = *slashptr;
2558 | 				*slashptr = '\0';
2559 | 			} else slashptr = (char *)NULL;
2560 | 
2561 | 			/** see if escaped **/
2562 | 			if ((result != dollarptr) && *(dollarptr - 1) == '\\') {
2563 | 				/** replace \ with 0 and copy rest of name **/
2564 | 				buffer[blen - 1] = '\0';
2565 | 				strncat(buffer, dollarptr, MOD_BUFSIZE-blen);
2566 | 				blen = strlen(buffer);
2567 | 				if(brace)
2568 | 					strncat(buffer,"}",MOD_BUFSIZE-blen-1);
2569 | 			} else {
2570 | 				if (! strcmp(dollarptr + 1 + brace, "$")) {
2571 | 					/** put in the process pid **/
2572 | 					pid = getpid();
2573 | 					sprintf(buffer + blen,"%ld",(long)pid);
2574 | 				} else {
2575 | 					/** get env.var. value **/
2576 | 					envvar = getenv(dollarptr + 1 + brace);
2577 | 
2578 | 					/** cat value to rest of string **/
2579 | 					if (envvar) strncat(buffer,envvar,
2580 | 						MOD_BUFSIZE-blen-1);
2581 | 				}
2582 | 			}
2583 | 			blen = strlen(buffer);
2584 | 
2585 | 			/** start at slashptr and find next $ **/
2586 | 			if (slashptr) {
2587 | 				*slashptr = slashchr;
2588 | 				dollarptr = strchr(slashptr, '$');
2589 | 				/** copy everything upto $ **/
2590 | 				if (dollarptr) *dollarptr = '\0';
2591 | 				strncat(buffer, slashptr + brace,
2592 | 					MOD_BUFSIZE -blen -1);
2593 | 				if (dollarptr) {
2594 | 					*dollarptr = '$';
2595 | 					strncpy(oldbuffer, buffer, MOD_BUFSIZE);
2596 | 				}
2597 | 			} else {		/** no more to show **/
2598 | 				dollarptr = (char *)NULL;
2599 | 			}
2600 | 		}
2601 | 		null_free((void *) &result);
2602 | 		return stringer(NULL,0, buffer, NULL);
2603 | 	}
2604 | 
2605 | } /** End of 'xdup' **/
2606 | 
2607 | /*++++
2608 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
2609 |  ** 									     **
2610 |  **   Function:		xgetenv						     **
2611 |  ** 									     **
2612 |  **   Description:	will return an expanded environment variable.	     **
2613 |  ** 			However, it will only expand 1 level.		     **
2614 |  ** 			See xdup() for details.				     **
2615 |  ** 									     **
2616 |  **   First Edition:	2000/01/18	R.K.Owen <rk@owen.sj.ca.us>	     **
2617 |  ** 									     **
2618 |  **   Parameters:	char	*var		Environment variable	     **
2619 |  ** 									     **
2620 |  **   Result:		char    *		An allocated string	     **
2621 |  ** 									     **
2622 |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
2623 |  ** 									     **
2624 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
2625 |  ++++*/
2626 | 
2627 | char *xgetenv(char const * var) {
2628 | 	char *result = NULL;
2629 | 
2630 | 	if (var == (char *)NULL) return result;
2631 | 
2632 | 	return xdup(getenv(var));
2633 | 
2634 | } /** End of 'xgetenv' **/
2635 | 
2636 | /*++++
2637 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
2638 |  ** 									     **
2639 |  **   Function:		EscapeCshString(char* in,char* out)                  **
2640 |  ** 									     **
2641 |  **   Description:	will translate input string to escaped output string **
2642 |  **                     out must be allocated first                          **
2643 |  ** 									     **
2644 |  **   First Edition:	2002/04/10					     **
2645 |  ** 									     **
2646 |  **   Parameters:	char	*in		input            	     **
2647 |  **              	char	*out		output               	     **
2648 |  ** 									     **
2649 |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
2650 |  ** 									     **
2651 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
2652 |  ++++*/
2653 | 
2654 | void EscapeCshString(const char* in,
2655 | 		     char* out) {
2656 |   
2657 |   for(;*in;in++) {
2658 |     if (*in == ' ' ||
2659 | 	*in == '\t'||
2660 | 	*in == '\\'||
2661 | 	*in == '{' ||
2662 | 	*in == '}' ||
2663 | 	*in == '|' ||
2664 | 	*in == '<' ||
2665 | 	*in == '>' ||
2666 | 	*in == '!' ||
2667 | 	*in == ';' ||
2668 | 	*in == '#' ||
2669 | 	*in == '$' ||
2670 | 	*in == '^' ||
2671 | 	*in == '&' ||
2672 | 	*in == '*' ||
2673 | 	*in == '\''||
2674 | 	*in == '"' ||
2675 | 	*in == '(' ||
2676 | 	*in == ')') {
2677 |       *out++ = '\\';
2678 |     }
2679 |     *out++ = *in;
2680 |   }
2681 |   *out = 0;
2682 | }
2683 | 
2684 | void EscapeShString(const char* in,
2685 | 		     char* out) {
2686 |   
2687 |   for(;*in;in++) {
2688 |     if (*in == ' ' ||
2689 | 	*in == '\t'||
2690 | 	*in == '\\'||
2691 | 	*in == '{' ||
2692 | 	*in == '}' ||
2693 | 	*in == '|' ||
2694 | 	*in == '<' ||
2695 | 	*in == '>' ||
2696 | 	*in == '!' ||
2697 | 	*in == ';' ||
2698 | 	*in == '#' ||
2699 | 	*in == '$' ||
2700 | 	*in == '^' ||
2701 | 	*in == '&' ||
2702 | 	*in == '*' ||
2703 | 	*in == '\''||
2704 | 	*in == '"' ||
2705 | 	*in == '(' ||
2706 | 	*in == ')') {
2707 |       *out++ = '\\';
2708 |     }
2709 |     *out++ = *in;
2710 |   }
2711 |   *out = 0;
2712 | }

2718 |     if (*in == '\\'||

2733 |  **   Description:	emulates tempnam  and tmpnam  and mktemp             **
2734 |  **                     Atomically creates a unique temp file and opens it   **

2736 |  **                     Filename and file handle are returned through        **
2737 |  **                     argument pointers                                    **
2738 |  ** 									     **
2739 |  **   First Edition:	2002/04/22					     **
2740 |  ** 									     **
2741 |  **   Parameters:	char	**filename	pointer to char* 	     **
2742 |  **              	char	**file          pointer to FILE*     	     **
2743 |  ** 									     **
2744 |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
2745 |  ** 									     **
2746 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
2747 |  ++++*/
2748 | 
2749 | int tmpfile_mod(char** filename, FILE** file) {
2750 |   char* filename2;
2751 |   int trial = 0;
2752 | 
2753 |   if ((char *) NULL == (filename2 =
2754 | 	 stringer(NULL, strlen(TMP_DIR)+strlen("modulesource")+20, NULL)))
2755 |      if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
2756 | 	 return 1;
2757 |   
2758 |   do {
2759 |     int fildes;
2760 | 
2761 |     sprintf(filename2,"%s/modulesource_%d",TMP_DIR,trial++);
2762 |     fildes = open(filename2,O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | O_EXCL | O_TRUNC,0755);
2763 | #if 0
2764 |     fprintf(stderr,"DEBUG: filename=%s fildes=%d\n",
2765 | 	   filename2,fildes);
2766 | #endif
2767 |     if (fildes >=0) {
2768 |       *file = fdopen(fildes,"w");
2769 |       *filename = filename2;
2770 |       return 0;
2771 |     }
2772 |   } while (trial < 1000);
2773 | 
2774 |   null_free((void *) &filename2);
2775 |   fprintf(stderr,
2776 | 	_("FATAL: could not get a temp file! at %s(%d)"),__FILE__,__LINE__);
2777 |   
2778 |   return 1;
2779 | }

2781 | 
2782 | /*++++
2783 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
2784 |  ** 									     **
2785 |  **   Function:		stringer					     **
2786 |  ** 									     **
2787 |  **   Description:	Safely copies and concats series of strings	     **
2788 |  **			until it hits a NULL argument.			     **
2789 |  **			Either a buffer & length are given or if the buffer  **
2790 |  **			pointer is NULL then it will allocate memory to the  **
2791 |  **			given length. If the length is 0 then get the length **
2792 |  **			from the series of strings.			     **
2793 |  **			The resultant buffer is returned unless there	     **
2794 |  **			is an error then NULL is returned.		     **
2795 |  **			(Therefore, one of the main uses of stringer is to   **
2796 |  **			 allocate string memory.)			     **
2797 |  ** 									     **
2798 |  ** 									     **
2799 |  **   First Edition:	2001/08/08	R.K.Owen <rk@owen.sj.ca.us>	     **
2800 |  ** 									     **
2801 |  **   Parameters:	char		*buffer	string buffer (if not NULL)  **
2802 |  **			int		 len	maximum length of buffer     **
2803 |  **			const char	*str1	1st string to copy to buffer **
2804 |  **			const char	*str2	2nd string to cat  to buffer **
2805 |  ** 			...						     **
2806 |  **			const char	*strN	Nth string to cat  to buffer **
2807 |  **			const char	*NULL	end of arguments	     **
2808 |  ** 									     **
2809 |  **   Result:		char		*buffer	if successful completion    **
2810 |  ** 					else NULL			     **
2811 |  ** 									     **
2812 |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
2813 |  ** 									     **
2814 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
2815 |  ++++*/
2816 | 
2817 | char *stringer(	char *		buffer,
2818 | 		int		len,
2819 | 		... )
2820 | {
2821 | 	va_list	 argptr;	/** stdarg argument ptr			**/
2822 | 	char	*ptr;		/** argument string ptr			**/
2823 | 	char	*tbuf = buffer;	/** tempory buffer  ptr			**/
2824 | 	int	 sumlen = 0;	/** length of all the concat strings	**/
2825 | 	char	*(*strfn)(char*,const char*) = strcpy;
2826 | 				/** ptr to 1st string function		**/
2827 | 
2828 | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
2829 |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_stringer, NULL);
2830 | #endif
2831 | 
2832 | 	/* get start of optional arguments and sum string lengths */
2833 | 	va_start(argptr, len);
2834 | 	while ((ptr = va_arg(argptr, char *))) {
2835 | 		sumlen += strlen(ptr);
2836 | 	}
2837 | 	va_end(argptr);
2838 | 
2839 | 	/* can we even proceed? */
2840 | 	if (tbuf && (sumlen >= len || len < 0)) {
2841 | 		return (char *) NULL;
2842 | 	}
2843 | 
2844 | 	/* do we need to allocate memory? */
2845 | 	if (tbuf == (char *) NULL) {
2846 | 		if (len == 0) {
2847 | 			len = sumlen + 1;
2848 | 		}
2849 | 		if ((char *) NULL == (tbuf = (char*) module_malloc(len))) {
2850 | 			if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
2851 | 				return (char *) NULL;
2852 | 		}
2853 | 	}
2854 | 
2855 | 	/* concat all the strings to buffer */
2856 | 	va_start(argptr, len);
2857 | 	while ((ptr = va_arg(argptr, char *))) {
2858 | 		strfn(tbuf, ptr);
2859 | 		strfn = strcat;
2860 | 	}
2861 | 	va_end(argptr);
2862 | 
2863 | 	/* got here successfully - return buffer */
2864 | 	return tbuf;
2865 | 
2866 | } /** End of 'stringer' **/
2867 | 
2868 | /*++++
2869 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
2870 |  ** 									     **
2871 |  **   Function:		null_free					     **
2872 |  ** 									     **
2873 |  **   Description:	does a free and then nulls the pointer.		     **
2874 |  ** 									     **
2875 |  **   first edition:	2000/08/24	r.k.owen <rk@owen.sj.ca.us>	     **
2876 |  ** 									     **
2877 |  **   parameters:	void	**var		allocated memory	     **
2878 |  ** 									     **
2879 |  **   result:		void    		(nothing)		     **
2880 |  ** 									     **
2881 |  **   attached globals:	-						     **
2882 |  ** 									     **
2883 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
2884 |  ++++*/
2885 | 
2886 | void null_free(void ** var) {
2887 | 
2888 | 	if (! *var) return;	/* passed in a NULL ptr */
2889 | 
2890 | #ifdef USE_FREE
2891 | 	free( *var);
2892 | #endif
2893 | 	*var = NULL;
2894 | 
2895 | } /** End of 'null_free' **/
2896 |

2898 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
2899 |  ** 									     **
2900 |  **   Function:		countTclHash					     **
2901 |  ** 									     **
2902 |  **   Description:	returns the number of hash entries in a TclHash	     **
2903 |  ** 									     **
2904 |  **   first edition:	2005/09/01	R.K.Owen <rk@owen.sj.ca.us>	     **
2905 |  ** 									     **
2906 |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_HashTable	*table	Hash to count		     **
2907 |  ** 									     **
2908 |  **   Result:		size_t			Count of Hash Entries	     **
2909 |  ** 									     **
2910 |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
2911 |  ** 									     **
2912 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
2913 |  ++++*/
2914 | 
2915 | 
2916 | size_t countTclHash(Tcl_HashTable *table) {
2917 | 	size_t result = 0;
2918 | 	Tcl_HashSearch	 searchPtr;	/** Tcl hash search handle	     **/
2919 | 
2920 | 	if(Tcl_FirstHashEntry(table, &searchPtr)) {
2921 | 
2922 | 	    do {
2923 | 		result++;
2924 | 	    } while(Tcl_NextHashEntry( &searchPtr));
2925 | 
2926 | 	} /** if **/
2927 | 
2928 | 	return result;
2929 | } /** End of 'countHashTable' **/
2930 | 
2931 | /*++++
2932 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
2933 |  ** 									     **
2934 |  **   Function:		ReturnValue					     **
2935 |  ** 									     **
2936 |  **   Description:	Handles the various possible return values	     **
2937 |  ** 									     **
2938 |  **   first edition:	2006/02/13	R.K.Owen <rk@owen.sj.ca.us>	     **
2939 |  ** 									     **
2940 |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp      *interp		Attached Tcl Interp. **
2941 |  **			int		retval		Return value to check**
2942 |  ** 									     **
2943 |  **   Result:		EM_RetVal		Limited set		     **
2944 |  ** 									     **
2945 |  **   Attached Globals:	g_retval	set to N if "exit N"		     **
2946 |  ** 									     **
2947 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
2948 |  ++++*/
2949 | 
2950 | 
2951 | EM_RetVal ReturnValue(Tcl_Interp *interp, int retval) {
2952 | 	EM_RetVal	 em_result;
2953 | 	char		*startp		= (char *) NULL,
2954 | 			*endp		= (char *) NULL;
2955 | 	const char 	*tstr;
2956 | 	int		 result;
2957 | 	static Tcl_RegExp	exit__expPtr,
2958 | 				break_expPtr,
2959 | 				continue_expPtr;
2960 | 
2961 | 	tstr = (const char *) TCL_RESULT(interp);
2962 | 
2963 | 	/* compile regular expression the first time through */
2964 | 	if (!exit__expPtr)
2965 | 		exit__expPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp, "^EXIT ([0-9]*)");
2966 | 
2967 | 	/*  result = "invoked \"break\" outside of a loop" */
2968 | 	if (!break_expPtr)
2969 | 		break_expPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp, ".*\"break\".*");
2970 | 
2971 | 	/*  result = "invoked \"continue\" outside of a loop" */
2972 | 	if (!continue_expPtr)
2973 | 		continue_expPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp, ".*\"continue\".*");
2974 | 
2975 | 	/* intercept any "EXIT N" first */
2976 | 	if(tstr && *tstr && 0 < Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, exit__expPtr,
2977 | 		(CONST84 char *) tstr, (CONST84 char *) tstr)){
2978 | 		/* found 'EXIT' */
2979 | 		Tcl_RegExpRange(exit__expPtr, 1,
2980 | 			(CONST84 char **) &startp, (CONST84 char **) &endp);
2981 | 		if( startp != '\0')
2982 | 			result = atoi((const char *) startp);
2983 | 
2984 | 		g_retval = result;
2985 | 		em_result = EM_EXIT;
2986 | 
2987 | 	/* check for a break not within loop */
2988 | 	} else if(tstr && *tstr && 0 < Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, break_expPtr,
2989 | 		(CONST84 char *) tstr, (CONST84 char *) tstr)){
2990 | 		em_result = EM_BREAK;
2991 | 
2992 | 	/* check for a continue not within loop */
2993 | 	} else if(tstr && *tstr && 0 < Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, continue_expPtr,
2994 | 		(CONST84 char *) tstr, (CONST84 char *) tstr)){
2995 | 		em_result = EM_CONTINUE;
2996 | 
2997 | 	} else {
2998 | 		switch (retval) {
2999 | 		case TCL_OK:
3000 | 			em_result = EM_OK;
3001 | 			break;
3002 | 		case TCL_BREAK:
3003 | 			em_result = EM_BREAK;
3004 | 			break;
3005 | 		case TCL_CONTINUE:
3006 | 			em_result = EM_CONTINUE;
3007 | 			break;
3008 | 		case TCL_ERROR:
3009 | 		default:
3010 | 			em_result = EM_ERROR;
3011 | 			break;
3012 | 		}
3013 | 	}
3014 | 	return em_result;
3015 | } /** End of 'ReturnValue' **/
3016 | 
3017 | /*++++
3018 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
3019 |  ** 									     **
3020 |  **   Function:		OutputExit					     **
3021 |  ** 									     **
3022 |  **   Description:	Outputs a 'test 0 = 1' line so command will eval     **
3023 |  ** 			with a non-zero	exit code			     **
3024 |  ** 									     **
3025 |  **   first edition:	2006/03/07	R.K.Owen <rk@owen.sj.ca.us>	     **
3026 |  ** 									     **
3027 |  **   Parameters:	void			none			     **
3028 |  ** 									     **
3029 |  **   result:		void    		(nothing)		     **
3030 |  ** 									     **
3031 |  **   Attached Globals:	g_retval	if non-zero			     **
3032 |  **   			g_output	if non-zero			     **
3033 |  ** 									     **
3034 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
3035 |  ++++*/
3036 | void OutputExit() {
3037 | 
3038 | 	if (shell_derelict == NULL) {
3039 | 		return;
3040 | 	} else if( !strcmp( shell_derelict, "csh")) {
3041 | 		/* OK shell derelict */
3042 | 	} else if( !strcmp( shell_derelict, "sh")) {
3043 | 		/* OK shell derelict */
3044 | 	} else {
3045 | 		return;
3046 | 	}
3047 | 	if (g_retval) {
3048 | 		fprintf( stdout, " test 0 = 1;");
3049 | 	}
3050 | } /** End of 'OutputExit' **/
